summary: The concept of "judicial investigation" within the EU legal framework refers to the procedural actions undertaken by judicial authorities to gather evidence and ascertain facts in relation to a legal case. This investigative phase is crucial for ensuring the integrity of the justice system, as it allows for the thorough examination of circumstances surrounding alleged offenses. Judicial investigations are governed by various EU regulations and directives, which aim to harmonize standards across member states. These investigations may involve cooperation between national courts and EU institutions, reflecting the interconnected nature of justice in the European Union.
